articles.title: My Friend, David
articles.articleText: This is my friend, David. He is twenty years old and is a student at a university in the city. David is tall and has short, brown hair and blue eyes. He is very friendly and funny. He lives in a small apartment near the school with another student. Their apartment has two bedrooms, a kitchen, and one bathroom. David's favorite subject is history because he thinks the past is very interesting. He reads a lot of books about history. In his free time, he likes to play the guitar. He is in a small band with his friends. They practice on Saturday afternoon. They play good music. David also has a part-time job. He works in a cafe on Friday and Sunday. He serves coffee and cake to customers. He likes his job because he can meet many new people. He wants to be a history teacher in the future. He is a very busy person, but he is always happy. He says that learning new things is his favorite activity. I think David is a wonderful person and a great friend. I am happy to know him.

articles.title: A Day at the Market
articles.articleText: Today is Saturday. The weather is warm and the sun is in the sky. My family and I go to the market. The market is very busy. There are many people. We need to buy food for the week. First, we go to the fruit section. I see red apples, yellow bananas, and green pears. My mother buys a bag of apples and some bananas. They look delicious. Then, we go to the vegetable section. My father chooses some carrots, potatoes, and tomatoes. He says vegetables are very healthy. After that, we need some bread and milk. We go to a small shop in the market. The bread is warm. We also buy cheese and eggs. I see a man selling fish. The fish looks very fresh. My mother pays for everything. The total cost is twenty dollars. We carry the food in two big bags. I feel a little tired but happy. Tonight, my mother will cook a big dinner with all this fresh food. I love going to the market with my family. It is a fun activity for the weekend. We always find something new and interesting.

There are three rooms in my apartment: a bedroom, a bathroom, and one big room that is a kitchen and a living area. In my bedroom, I have a bed, a small desk, and a chair. My computer is on the desk. I do my homework there. The window in my bedroom looks out at a small park. In the morning, I can hear birds sing. The bathroom is small and white. It has a shower and a toilet. The main room is my favorite part of the apartment. The kitchen section has a refrigerator, a stove, and a small table. I cook my meals here. I like to make pasta and salad. The living area has a comfortable sofa and a small television. I watch movies on the weekend. My apartment is near a bus station, so it is easy for me to go to work. I have a friendly neighbor. Her name is Sarah and she lives next door. We sometimes have coffee together.

articles.title: My Daily Routine
articles.articleText: My name is Tom and I am a student. My day is usually very busy. I wake up at seven o'clock every morning. First, I go to the bathroom to wash my face. Then, I get dressed. I usually wear jeans and a T-shirt to school. After that, I go to the kitchen to have breakfast. My mother makes a delicious breakfast for me. I usually have eggs, bread, and a glass of milk. I leave my house at eight o'clock. My school is not far from my house, so I walk. It takes about fifteen minutes. My classes start at eight-thirty. I have four classes in the morning. My favorite subject is science. At noon, I have lunch with my friends in the school cafeteria. After lunch, I have two more classes. I finish school at three o'clock. When I get home, I relax for an hour. I listen to music or read a book. Then, I do my homework. In the evening, I have dinner with my family at seven o'clock. We talk about our day. After dinner, I watch TV or play a computer game. I go to bed at ten o'clock because I need to be ready for the next day.

articles.title: A Trip to the Zoo
articles.articleText: Yesterday was Sunday, and the weather was beautiful. My family decided to visit the city zoo. The zoo is a very big place with many different animals. We arrived at ten o'clock in the morning. First, we went to see the lions. They were big and strong. A male lion was sleeping under a tree. He looked very lazy. Next, we saw the elephants. They were huge! An elephant was drinking water with its long nose. It was amazing to watch. After that, we saw the monkeys. The monkeys were very funny. They climbed and played together. They ate bananas that a zookeeper gave them. My little sister laughed a lot. We also saw snakes in the reptile house. I was a little afraid of them. They were very quiet. For lunch, we ate sandwiches at a small cafe inside the zoo. In the afternoon, we saw the penguins. They were black and white, and they were swimming in the cold water. They looked so happy. We left the zoo at four o'clock. It was a wonderful day. My favorite animal was the elephant. I want to go back to the zoo again soon.

I enjoy stories about history, because I can learn about the past. I also like fantasy books with magic and amazing creatures. Reading is a great way to relax. After a long day at school or work, I sit in my favorite chair with a good book and a cup of tea. It helps me to forget about any problems. I can travel to a different world without leaving my room. I usually read for an hour every night before I go to sleep. On the weekend, I can read for many hours. I often go to the local library to find new books. The library is a quiet place and has thousands of books. It's free to join. Reading also helps me to learn new words and improve my English. It is a wonderful hobby.

We looked out the window and saw many green fields and small towns. It was very beautiful. We arrived at a small town in the mountains at eleven o'clock. The air was fresh and cold. We went to our hotel. It was a small, friendly place. Our room was on the second floor and had a great view of a big mountain. After we left our bags, we went for a walk. We walked on a long path next to a river. We saw many tall trees and colorful flowers. We took a lot of photos with our cameras. In the evening, we ate dinner at a local restaurant. I had fish and rice, and Anna had chicken and potatoes. The food was delicious. On Sunday, we climbed a small hill. It was not a difficult climb. From the top, the view was fantastic. We could see the whole town below. We took the train back home in the afternoon. We were tired, but very happy. It was a wonderful trip.

Then we were a little hungry. We went to the food court in the mall. I had a chicken sandwich and Lisa had a salad. We also had some orange juice. It was a fun break from shopping. The walls were red, and there were pictures of Italy on the walls. The tables had white cloths and a small flower in a glass. A friendly waiter showed us to our table. He gave us the menu. After the starter, we had our main course. I chose pasta with cheese and pepper. My girlfriend had a large pizza with chicken and vegetables. We shared a little of our food. Both dishes were wonderful. For our drink, we both had a glass of water. We talked and laughed a lot during the meal. We did not have dessert because we were very full. We asked for the bill. The waiter brought it to our table. The meal cost thirty-five dollars. We thought it was a good price for such great food. We left the restaurant feeling happy. We will definitely go back to 'The Happy Tomato' again.

We listen to conversations and repeat sentences. We read short articles and then answer questions. We also practice writing. We write emails or short stories. My favorite part is the speaking activity. We work in pairs or small groups and talk about different topics, like food, hobbies, or travel. Sometimes we play games to learn new words. It's a lot of fun. I have to do homework after every lesson. It usually takes about an hour. I think my English is getting better. I can understand more, and I can speak more. I am happy that I decided to join this class. Learning a new language is hard work, but it is also very exciting.

articles.articleText: Last summer, my family went on vacation to the beach. We stayed in a small hotel near the ocean. Every day, we spent hours on the beach. The sand was white and soft. The water was blue and warm. The weather was hot and sunny every single day. In the morning, my brother and I would swim in the ocean. The waves were small, so it was safe. My father would relax under a big umbrella and read a book. My mother loved to walk along the water and collect beautiful shells. For lunch, we often ate at a small beach cafe. They had delicious fish and chips. I always had ice cream for dessert. In the afternoon, we played games on the sand. We played volleyball and built a big sandcastle. My brother was very good at building tall towers. One afternoon, we saw a group of dolphins swimming in the distance. It was an amazing sight. In the evening, we would watch the sunset. The sun looked like a big orange ball going down into the water. The sky was full of beautiful colors, like pink, purple, and orange. I love the beach. It's a wonderful place to relax and have fun.

articles.title: My Job as a Waiter
articles.articleText: I have a part-time job as a waiter in a small restaurant. The restaurant is in my neighborhood, so it's a short walk from my house. I work three evenings a week: on Wednesday, Friday, and Saturday. My work starts at five o'clock and finishes at ten o'clock. The restaurant is usually very busy, especially on the weekend. My job has many parts. First, I welcome the customers and show them to a table. I give them a menu and a glass of water. Then, after a few minutes, I return to take their order. I write down what they want to eat and drink. I need to listen carefully to get the order correct. After that, I give the order to the cook in the kitchen. When the food is ready, I carry the plates to the table. The plates can be very hot, so I have to be careful. During the meal, I check on the customers to see if they need anything else. At the end, I give them the bill. It can be a hard job because I am on my feet for five hours. But I like my job. The other workers are friendly, and the customers are usually nice. I also get to eat delicious food.

The kitchen smelled delicious. After that, I sat on the sofa with a warm blanket and read a book. The book was an adventure story about a boy on an island. It was very exciting. In the afternoon, my brother and I played a board game. He won the first game, but I won the second one. Then we watched a funny movie on television and ate the cookies we made. The rain finally stopped in the evening. I saw a beautiful rainbow in the sky. A rainy day at home can be fun, too.

It was a big chocolate cake with ten candles on it. We all sang 'Happy Birthday' to Jane. She made a wish and blew out the candles. Then, everyone got a big piece of cake. It was so good! We went to the airport early in the morning. The airport was a huge, busy place with thousands of people. First, we had to check in our bags and get our tickets. Then, we went through security. Finally, we walked to our gate and waited for our plane. When I saw the airplane through the big window, I thought it was amazing. It was so big! When we got on the plane, a friendly flight attendant showed us to our seats. I had a window seat. I could see everything on the ground. When the plane started to move, I was a little nervous. It moved fast down the road, and then suddenly, we were in the air! It was a strange feeling. I looked down and saw the houses and cars get smaller and smaller. It was like looking at a map. During the flight, I watched a movie and listened to music. They also gave us a small meal with chicken and rice. The flight was four hours long. I enjoyed every minute of it.

My favorite part was the gallery with old paintings. There were hundreds of paintings on the walls. Some were portraits of important people, and others showed historical events. I saw a painting of a big sea battle. It was very impressive. We spent about three hours in the museum. Before we left, I bought a postcard of my favorite painting from the museum shop. It was a great day. I learned so much and saw so many amazing things. I want to visit again with my family.

I cannot start my day without coffee. While I eat my breakfast, I read the news on my phone or listen to the radio. I like to know what is happening in the world. At a quarter past seven, I wash my plate and cup. Then I brush my teeth. I leave the house at half past seven. I walk to the train station. My train to the city center leaves at ten to eight. I enjoy my morning routine because it is quiet and helps me prepare for a busy day at the office.

articles.title: My Favorite Season
articles.articleText: There are four seasons in a year, but my favorite season is fall, which is also called autumn. Fall comes after summer and before winter. In my country, fall is during the months of September, October, and November. I love fall for many reasons. First, the weather is perfect. It's not too hot like in summer, and not too cold like in winter. It's just cool and comfortable. I can wear a nice sweater or a light jacket. Second, the colors of fall are beautiful. The leaves on the trees change from green to amazing colors like red, orange, and yellow. Walking in a park during fall is like walking through a painting. I love the sound of dry leaves under my feet. Another reason I love fall is the food. It's the season for apples and pumpkins. My mother makes delicious apple pie, and we drink hot chocolate in the evening. The air feels fresh and clean. Also, my birthday is in October, so it is a special time for me. I think each season has something nice, but for me, fall is the best. It's a quiet and beautiful time of the year before the cold winter arrives.

articles.title: Making a Pizza
articles.articleText: Last night, my father and I decided to make pizza for dinner. We didn't buy a frozen pizza; we made it from the beginning. First, we went to the supermarket to buy everything we needed. We bought flour, yeast, tomatoes, cheese, and pepper. Back at home, we started in the kitchen. My father showed me how to make the pizza dough. We mixed the flour, water, and yeast in a big bowl. Then, we had to knead the dough with our hands for about ten minutes. It was hard work but fun. After that, we left the dough in a warm place to grow for an hour. While we waited, we made the tomato sauce. We cut the tomatoes and cooked them with some salt and herbs. When the dough was ready, it was much bigger. We made it flat and round. Then, we put the tomato sauce on top. After the sauce, we added a lot of cheese. I love cheese, so I put extra on my half. Finally, we added some green pepper. We put the pizza in the hot oven for fifteen minutes. When it came out, it smelled wonderful. The pizza was delicious, much better than a store-bought pizza. It was a fun cooking experience.

I would stay in a small house, a bungalow, right on the beach. Every morning, I would wake up to the sound of the ocean. I would have a simple breakfast of fresh fruit, like mango and pineapple, and a glass of juice. I would not have a busy schedule. The main plan would be to relax. I would spend a lot of time swimming in the warm sea and reading books under a palm tree. I would also like to go for long walks along the beach and watch the beautiful sunsets in the evening. Maybe I would try something new, like snorkeling, to see the colorful fish under the water. I would not want to check my email or use the internet very much. I would turn off my phone. In the evening, I would eat dinner at a small, local restaurant. I would try fresh fish and other local food. This trip would be a time to forget about work and the busy city life. It would be a time to be quiet, read, and enjoy nature. It's a simple dream, but for me, it is the perfect vacation.

They were still warm! After that, we saw the pigs. They were pink and very noisy. They were playing in the mud and seemed very happy. My favorite animal was a big brown horse. The farmer said I could give it an apple. The horse was very gentle. Before we left, we bought some fresh milk and cheese from the farm's small shop. It was a wonderful day. I learned a lot about animals and where our food comes from. I want to go back to the farm again in the summer.

I usually spend about two hours in the library. First, I return the books I took last week. Then, I walk around and look for new books to read. I like stories about adventure and mystery. Sometimes, I also take out a music CD or a movie DVD. The library also has computers that anyone can use for free. I sometimes use them to do my homework or check my email. articles.title: Learning to Ride a Bike
articles.articleText: I remember the day I learned to ride a bicycle. I was seven years old. My father bought me a new, red bike for my birthday. It was beautiful and shiny. I was very excited, but also a little afraid. I did not want to fall. We went to the park near our house. The park had a long, flat path, which was a perfect place to learn. At first, my father held the back of the bike. I sat on the seat and put my feet on the pedals. I started to pedal, and my father ran behind me. It was difficult to keep the bike straight. I was very wobbly. We tried this many times. I was getting tired and a little sad. I thought I would never learn. But my father said, 'Try again. You can do it.' So, I tried one more time. This time, my father let go of the bike, but he did not tell me. I pedaled and pedaled, and suddenly I was riding all by myself! I was so surprised and happy. I rode for about twenty meters before I stopped. It was an amazing feeling. From that day on, I loved riding my bike. It was a great lesson in not giving up.

articles.title: A Healthy Lifestyle
articles.articleText: Living a healthy lifestyle is very important. It helps your body and your mind to be strong. There are some simple things you can do every day. First, you should eat healthy food. This means eating a lot of fruits and vegetables. They are full of vitamins. You should also eat food like bread, rice, and pasta. It is a good idea to eat less sugar and fat. Things like cake, chocolate, and fast food are delicious, but not very healthy if you eat them often. Second, exercise is very important. You don't have to go to the gym for two hours every day. A short walk for thirty minutes is a great start. You can also ride a bike, swim, or play a sport like tennis or football. The main idea is to move your body. Third, you need to get enough sleep. Most adults need about eight hours of sleep every night. Sleep helps your body to rest and get ready for the next day. Finally, it is important to drink a lot of water. Your body needs water to work correctly. Living healthy is not difficult, it is about making good choices every day.

I listened to music on my phone and read a book for about an hour. A woman with a small cart came through the train selling drinks and snacks. I bought a cup of coffee and a chocolate bar. It was a very comfortable and relaxing way to travel. I prefer the train to the bus because it is faster and you can see more.

I used two big balls of snow for the body and head. I used small stones for the eyes and a carrot for the nose. He looked very funny. Then, my friends from next door came out to play too. We had a snowball fight. It was a lot of fun. We laughed and ran around for about an hour. After that, we were all very cold and tired. We went inside my house. My mother made us hot chocolate. articles.title: A Famous Artist
articles.articleText: Let me tell you about a famous artist named Vincent van Gogh. He was a Dutch painter. He was born in 1853. Many people think he is one of the most important artists in history. However, during his life, he was not very famous or successful. He was actually quite a poor man. He only sold one painting when he was alive. Van Gogh's style of painting was very different for his time. He used strong, bright colors and thick paint. You can see the brush strokes in his paintings. He painted many different subjects. He painted pictures of flowers, especially sunflowers. He also painted pictures of the countryside, with its fields and trees. He painted many self-portraits, which are pictures of himself. One of his most famous paintings is called 'The Starry Night'. It shows a dark blue night sky with a bright yellow moon and big, shining stars over a small town. It is a very beautiful and emotional painting. He had a difficult life and was often sad. He died when he was only 37 years old. Today, his paintings are in museums all over the world and cost millions of dollars. It's interesting how a person can become famous only after they die.

articles.title: The Four Seasons
articles.articleText: In many parts of the world, there are four seasons in a year: spring, summer, fall, and winter. Each season is different and has its own special beauty. Spring is the season of new life. It comes after the long, cold winter. The weather gets warmer. The trees get new green leaves, and colorful flowers start to grow. Birds return and sing their songs. Many animals have their babies in the spring. Summer is the hottest season. The days are long and the nights are short. The sun is bright and strong. Many people go on vacation in the summer. They go to the beach to swim in the ocean or have picnics in the park. It's a time for fun and outdoor activities. Fall, or autumn, is a cooler season. The leaves on the trees change from green to beautiful colors like red, orange, and yellow. Then they fall to the ground. Farmers collect their food from the fields. The weather can be windy. Winter is the coldest season. In some places, it snows and everything is white. The days are short. People wear warm clothes like coats and sweaters. It's a quiet time of year, a good time to stay inside with a hot drink and a good book.

articles.title: A Weekend Camping Trip
articles.articleText: Last weekend, my best friend Sam and I went on a camping trip. We went to a national park about two hours away by car. We arrived on Saturday morning. The park was beautiful, with tall trees and a clean river. First, we had to find a good place to put our tent. We found a nice, flat area near the river. Setting up the tent was not easy. It was our first time, and we made a few mistakes. But after about thirty minutes, our little house was ready. In the afternoon, we went for a long walk. We followed a path through the forest. It was very quiet. We saw a few birds and a small deer. It was amazing to see a deer so close. In the evening, we made a fire. We sat by the warm fire and cooked hot dogs for dinner. They were delicious. Later, we looked up at the sky. There were thousands of stars. In the city, you can't see so many stars because of all the lights. We talked for a long time before we went to sleep in our tent. It was a little cold during the night, but it was a great adventure. I love being in nature.

articles.title: My Weekly Routine
articles.articleText: My week is usually very busy with work and other activities. I work in an office from Monday to Friday. My workday starts at nine o'clock and finishes at five o'clock. After work, I am usually a bit tired. On Monday and Wednesday evenings, I go to the gym for an hour. I like to run on the machine and do some exercises. It helps me to relax and stay healthy. On Tuesday evening, I have my Spanish language class. It's a two-hour class, and I really enjoy learning a new language. Thursday is my quiet evening. I usually just stay home, cook dinner, and watch a movie or read a book. Friday evening is different. I often meet my friends. We go to a restaurant for dinner or sometimes we go to the cinema. The weekend is my free time. On Saturday, I clean my apartment in the morning. In the afternoon, I often go shopping or visit my family. Sunday is my lazy day. I wake up late, read the newspaper, and just relax at home. I think it's important to have a good routine to balance work and fun.

articles.title: A Clever Dog
articles.articleText: In a small town, there lived a man named Mr. Harris and his dog, Rusty. Rusty was not a big dog, but he was very smart. Every morning, Mr. Harris went to the local shop to buy a newspaper. He always took Rusty with him. One morning, Mr. Harris was sick and could not leave his bed. He felt very sad because he wanted to read his newspaper. Rusty saw that his owner was unhappy. The clever dog had an idea. He took the money for the newspaper from a small table near the door. He then ran out of the house and went to the shop by himself. The shop owner, a woman named Mrs. Davis, knew Rusty well. She was very surprised to see the dog alone with money in his mouth. Rusty put the money on the floor and looked at the newspapers. Mrs. Davis laughed. She understood what the dog wanted. She took the money, gave Rusty the newspaper, and also gave him a small dog biscuit. Rusty ran back home and gave the newspaper to Mr. Harris in bed. Mr. Harris was amazed and so proud of his clever dog. He gave Rusty a big hug.

articles.title: Playing the Piano
articles.articleText: I have a hobby that I love very much. It is playing the piano. I have a big, black piano in my living room. I started to learn when I was ten years old. My teacher is a kind woman named Mrs. White. I have a lesson with her every Thursday after school. The lesson is one hour long. At first, it was very difficult. My fingers were slow, and I made many mistakes. But I practiced every day for about thirty minutes. Now, I can play some beautiful songs. I like to play old music, but I also enjoy playing popular songs from the radio. Playing the piano helps me to relax. When I feel sad or tired, I sit and play. The music makes me feel better. My family likes to listen when I play. Sometimes my mother sings with the music. It is a wonderful feeling to create music. I hope to become a better player in the future. Maybe one day I will play in a concert. That is my dream. For now, I am happy to play at home for my family.

articles.title: A Letter from Vacation
articles.articleText: Dear Mom and Dad, I am having a wonderful time on my vacation! The hotel is very nice. It is right next to the beach. My room is on the third floor, and I have a great view of the ocean from my window. The weather here is amazing. It is hot and sunny every day. Yesterday, I spent the whole day on the beach. I swam in the blue water and read my book under a big umbrella. The water was so warm and clear. For lunch, I ate at a small cafe on the beach. I had a delicious fish sandwich. Today, I am going to visit the old town. My friend told me it has beautiful old buildings and small, interesting shops. I want to buy some postcards to send to you and my friends. Tomorrow, I am planning to go on a boat trip to a small island. I am very excited about that. I am taking a lot of photos with my phone to show you when I get back. I feel so happy and relaxed. Thank you for this amazing trip. I will see you next Sunday. Love, Tom.

I like to look at the different countries and imagine traveling to them one day. My clothes are in a tall closet near the door. My room is usually clean because I like to have everything in its place. It is a quiet and peaceful room. I feel very relaxed and happy when I am in my bedroom.

I participated in the basketball game. My team played against a team from another class. It was a difficult game, but we worked together well. In the end, we won! It was a great feeling. My favorite part of the day was the final event, a fun race where four students from each class had to run with an egg on a spoon. It was very funny to watch. Many students dropped their eggs. Our team was not very fast, but we did not drop our egg. At the end of the day, there was a small ceremony. The head teacher gave prizes to all the winners. It was a fantastic day.

articles.title: A Visit to the Doctor
articles.articleText: Yesterday, I was not feeling well. I woke up with a bad headache and my body felt very warm. My mother said I probably had a fever. She called the doctor's office and made an appointment for me in the afternoon. My father took me to the doctor. The doctor's office was a quiet place with many people waiting. We sat and waited for about twenty minutes. Then, a nurse called my name. She took me to a small room. First, she checked my temperature. It was high. She also asked me some questions about how I felt. Then, the doctor came in. He was a kind, old man. He listened to my chest with a special instrument and looked in my ears and mouth. He said I had the flu, which is a common illness. He told me that I needed to rest at home for a few days. He said I should drink a lot of water and soup. He also gave my father a prescription for some medicine. We went to the pharmacy next door to buy the medicine. I am now at home in my bed. I feel very tired, but I know I will be better soon.

articles.title: My Favorite Drink
articles.articleText: Many people love coffee or tea, but my favorite drink is orange juice. I love everything about it. I love its bright orange color and its fresh, sweet taste. I drink a glass of orange juice every morning with my breakfast. It helps me to start my day in a happy and energetic way. My mother says it is very healthy because it is full of vitamins. I prefer fresh orange juice, not the juice from a bottle or a box. On the weekend, my father sometimes buys a big bag of oranges from the market. Then, we make our own juice at home. We have a special machine for it. We cut the oranges in half and put them on the machine. The machine turns and all the juice comes out. The smell of fresh oranges fills the whole kitchen. It smells so good! The juice we make at home tastes much better than the juice from the supermarket. It is so fresh and sweet. Sometimes in the summer, on a very hot day, I like to drink a cold glass of orange juice with some ice. It is the most refreshing drink in the world for me.

articles.title: A Funny Mistake
articles.articleText: I want to tell you about a funny mistake I made last week. I had a meeting in a part of the city I did not know well. I looked up the address on a map on my phone. The address was '123 Green Street'. I took a taxi to get there. I told the driver the address. He drove for about twenty minutes. When we arrived, I saw a small house with a big garden. It looked like a normal house, not an office building. I was a little confused. I thought, 'Maybe the office is in the back.' I paid the driver and got out of the car. I walked to the front door and rang the bell. An old woman opened the door. She looked very surprised to see me in my work clothes. I asked, 'Is this the office of the Star Company?' She laughed and said, 'No, dear, this is my house! You have the wrong place.' I felt my face get red. I looked at my phone again. I saw my mistake. The correct address was '123 Green Avenue', not Green Street. They were two different streets! I said sorry to the woman and quickly walked away. It was a silly mistake, but now I always check addresses twice.

articles.title: The Life of a Postman
articles.articleText: My neighbor, Mr. Smith, is a postman. His job is very important because he brings letters and packages to people in our neighborhood. His day starts very early. He has to wake up at five o'clock in the morning. First, he goes to the main post office. There, he sorts all the mail for his route. This means he has to put all the letters for each street in the correct order. This part of the job takes a long time. After he sorts the mail, he puts it all in a big bag. His bag is very heavy. Then, he starts his walk. He walks for many hours, in all kinds of weather. He walks in the sun, in the rain, and even in the snow. He goes from house to house, putting letters in the mailboxes. If he has a big package, he has to ring the person's doorbell. Most people are very happy to see him. He knows everyone in the neighborhood, and he is very friendly. He always says 'hello' with a big smile. His job is finished in the early afternoon. It is hard work, but Mr. Smith says he likes his job because he likes walking and talking to people.

articles.title: My Warm Winter Coat
articles.articleText: I have a favorite piece of clothing for the cold season. It is my warm winter coat. It is a long, dark gray coat. My parents gave it to me two years ago for my birthday. The outside of the coat is strong and keeps the wind and rain away. The inside is very soft and warm. It feels like a warm hug when I put it on. The coat has a big hood that I can put up when it is snowing or very windy. It helps to keep my head and ears warm. It also has four big pockets on the front. This is very useful. I can put my keys, my phone, and my gloves in the pockets, so I don't need to carry a bag. I wear this coat almost every day during the winter, from December to February. I wear it when I walk to the bus station, when I go shopping, or when I meet my friends. It is not the most modern or stylish coat in the world, but for me, it is perfect. It is very comfortable and practical. When I wear my warm winter coat, I don't feel the cold at all.

articles.title: A Day Without a Phone
articles.articleText: Yesterday morning, a terrible thing happened. I could not find my phone. I looked everywhere in my apartment: on the table, under the bed, in my bag, and in my coat pockets. It was gone. I felt very strange and a little lost without it. My phone is a very important part of my life. I use it to talk to my friends, check the time, listen to music, and read the news. How could I live for a whole day without it? At first, it was difficult. At the bus stop, I didn't know what to do. Usually, I listen to music or read something on my phone. Instead, I just looked out the window of the bus. I saw many interesting things in my city that I never noticed before. At work, I had to ask a colleague for the time. During my lunch break, I read a real newspaper instead of my phone. In the evening, I went home and read a book. It was very quiet. I had to go to sleep without listening to my favorite music. This morning, my neighbor rang my doorbell. He had my phone! I left it in the elevator yesterday. I was so happy to have it back. But I also learned that it is possible, and sometimes nice, to live without a phone for a day.

There are also many ducks and other birds on the water. They make a happy sound. There are many green trees along the path and benches where you can sit and relax. I often bring a book with me. I walk for about an hour, and then I find a quiet bench. I sit and read for a while and just watch the river. It is a very peaceful activity. It helps me to forget about my busy week at work. Being near the water and in nature makes me feel calm and happy.

Many different local bands play music during the day. People sit on the grass and listen, or they get up and dance. In the evening, a famous singer sometimes comes to perform. For children, there are games and a small ride. On Saturday night, the festival ends with an amazing firework show. The sky is full of beautiful, bright colors. In the late evening, at about seven o'clock, it started to get a little cooler. We went for a short walk in our neighborhood. The air was still very warm. We bought some ice cream from a small shop. articles.title: My Favorite Teacher
articles.articleText: When I was in high school, my favorite teacher was my history teacher, Mr. Evans. He was not like the other teachers. His classes were always so interesting and fun. He did not just read from a book. He told stories about the past that made history feel real and exciting. He had a very loud voice and was full of energy. He walked around the classroom and used his hands a lot when he talked. He showed us old photos, maps, and sometimes short films. He also made us think. He often asked us difficult questions and made us discuss our opinions in small groups. He wanted us to understand not just what happened in the past, but why it happened. He was also a very kind person. If a student had a problem with the homework, he was always happy to help after class. He remembered everyone's name and always asked us about our hobbies and interests. He made every student feel important. Because of Mr. Evans, history became my favorite subject. I learned so much from him, not just about history, but also about how to be a curious and kind person. I will always remember him.

articles.title: Cleaning My Room
articles.articleText: Every Saturday morning, I have to clean my room. I don't love this activity, but I know it is important to have a clean and tidy space. First, I open the window to let in some fresh air. Then, I start with my bed. I take off all the sheets and blankets and put clean ones on. Making the bed look neat is the first step. Next, I have to deal with my clothes. I put all my dirty clothes in a basket to be washed. I take the clean clothes from my closet and decide what to wear for the day. Then, I have to tidy my desk. It is usually a mess with books, papers, and pens everywhere. I put all my books back on the bookshelf and my pens in a cup. I put all the old papers in the trash. The final job is cleaning the floor. I use a vacuum cleaner to clean the rug. It makes a loud noise, but it works very well. After I finish, my room looks so much better. It is clean, smells fresh, and everything is in its correct place. It takes about one hour to do everything. Then, I am free to enjoy the rest of my weekend.

articles.title: A Family Dinner
articles.articleText: In my family, we have a special tradition. Every Sunday evening, we have a big family dinner together. It is my favorite meal of the week. During dinner, we talk and laugh a lot. We share stories about our week. The children talk about school, and the adults talk about their jobs. It is a time for us to connect with each other. After dinner, the adults have coffee and the children play a game. It is a simple tradition, but it is very important to us. It reminds us that family is the most important thing. articles.title: A Policeman's Job

articles.title: A Trip to the Aquarium
articles.articleText: Last Saturday, my family went on a day trip to the city aquarium. The aquarium is a huge building where you can see thousands of different sea animals. It was my first visit, and I was very excited. Inside, it was dark and the only light came from the big water tanks. It felt like we were under the ocean. The first thing we saw was a tank full of small, colorful fish. There were bright yellow, blue, and red fish swimming together. It was beautiful. Then, we walked through a long glass tunnel. This was the best part. Big sharks and giant sea turtles swam right over our heads. It was a little scary but also amazing. I saw a shark's sharp teeth! We also saw a funny animal called a sea lion. A keeper was feeding them fish, and they were making loud noises. In another section, there were strange and beautiful jellyfish. They looked like umbrellas dancing in the water. We spent about three hours there. Before we left, I bought a small toy shark from the gift shop to remember my visit. I learned so much about the amazing world under the sea.

articles.title: My Dream House
articles.articleText: I sometimes think about my dream house. It would not be a huge, modern house in a city. I would prefer a small, comfortable house in the country, near a forest or a lake. The house would be made of wood and have a big stone fireplace in the living room. In the winter, I could sit by a warm fire with a good book and a cup of hot chocolate. The kitchen would be big and full of light, with a large window looking out at the garden. I love cooking, so I would have a big stove and a lot of space to prepare food. The house would have three bedrooms. One for me, one for guests, and one room I would use as my office or study. The most important part of my dream house would be the outside area. I would have a big yard with many trees and flowers. I would also have a small vegetable garden where I could grow my own tomatoes, carrots, and potatoes. I would have a small wooden table and some chairs in the garden. I could eat my breakfast outside on sunny mornings. It would be a quiet and peaceful place to live, far from the noise of traffic.

articles.title: A Surprise Visitor
articles.articleText: Last Tuesday evening, I was at home watching television. It was a rainy and cold night. Suddenly, I heard a strange noise at my front door. It sounded like a small animal. I was a little afraid, but I went to see what it was. I opened the door slowly. On my doorstep, there was a small, wet kitten. It was black with white feet. The poor thing was very cold and hungry. It looked at me with big, sad eyes. I couldn't leave it outside in the rain. I brought it inside and gave it a warm, dry towel. Then, I went to the kitchen. I didn't have any cat food, so I gave it a small bowl of milk. The kitten drank all the milk very quickly. After that, it fell asleep on the rug in front of the fire. The next day, I took the kitten to the animal doctor to check if it was healthy. The doctor said the kitten was fine. I put up some signs in my neighborhood, but no one called. After a week, I decided to keep the kitten. I named him 'Shadow' because he is black. He is now a happy and playful member of my family.

articles.title: Learning a New Skill

I found some free lessons online. The videos showed me where to put my fingers and how to play some simple songs. I practiced for about thirty minutes every day after work. It was important to be patient. Slowly, very slowly, I started to get better. After a few weeks, I could play a whole song. It was a simple song, but I was very happy. It was a great feeling of success. Now, after a year, I can play many of my favorite songs. I am not a great player, but I enjoy it so much. I often play for my friends when they come to my house. Learning a new skill as an adult is not easy, but it is very rewarding. It teaches you to be patient and to never give up.

It is a day to celebrate all the workers in the country. It is also a great chance to relax and spend time with family and friends. Last Worker's Day, the weather was beautiful. It was warm and sunny. My family decided to have a picnic in the park. My mother prepared a lot of food. She made sandwiches with chicken and cheese, a big fruit salad, and some delicious cookies. My father packed a big blanket and some games. We went to the big park in the city center. It was very busy. Many other families had the same idea. We found a nice spot under a big, old tree. We ate our lunch and talked. After lunch, my brother and I played football with my father. It was a lot of fun. Later in the afternoon, we just lay on the blanket and watched the clouds in the blue sky. It was a very simple, but perfect day. I love public holidays because they are a break from our normal, busy routine.

In the center of our neighborhood, there is a small park. It has a playground for children and some benches. On sunny days, you can see many kids playing there. We also have a few local shops. There is a small supermarket, a bakery that sells delicious bread, and a cafe. If I need to do a lot of shopping, I have to go to the big mall, which is a short bus ride away. For me, it is the perfect place to live. It is peaceful and safe, but it is still easy to get to the city for work or to meet friends. I would not want to live anywhere else.

I usually arrive at the bus stop at eight o'clock. The bus, number 22, comes at ten past eight. I use a bus card to pay for my ticket. The bus is often full of people going to work or school. I see busy streets, quiet neighborhoods, and a big park. The journey takes about thirty minutes. The bus driver is a friendly man. He always says 'good morning' to everyone. Sometimes I listen to music on my phone during the trip, or I read a few pages of a book. The bus stops right in front of my college, so it is very useful. It is a simple part of my daily routine, but I enjoy watching the town wake up from the bus window. It's a much better way to travel than by car because I don't have to worry about traffic.

Our hair is messy from the wind. I love this photograph because it is not a perfect, posed picture. It is a real moment of happiness. When I look at it, I can almost hear the sound of the ocean and feel the warm sun. It reminds me of how important family is and the fun times we share together. If I am having a bad day at work, I look at this photo, and it always makes me smile. It's more than just a piece of paper; it's a beautiful memory.

articles.title: A Farmer's Life
articles.articleText: A farmer's life is a lot of hard work, but it can also be a wonderful life. A farmer wakes up very early in the morning, often before the sun comes up. The first job is usually to feed the animals. On a farm, you can find many kinds of animals, like cows, sheep, chickens, and pigs. The cows need to be milked every day. The chickens lay eggs, which the farmer collects. After taking care of the animals, the farmer has to work in the fields. A farmer grows plants like wheat, corn, potatoes, and other vegetables. This work changes with the seasons. In the spring, the farmer prepares the land and plants the seeds. In the summer, the farmer has to water the plants and make sure they are healthy. In the fall, it is time to harvest, which means collecting all the food from the fields. This is a very busy time. A farmer's work is never really finished. They have to know about animals, plants, and machines like tractors. They work outside in all kinds of weather. It is a very important job because farmers grow the food that we all eat.

articles.title: How to Make a Simple Sandwich
articles.articleText: Making a sandwich is a quick and easy way to prepare a meal. Let me tell you how I make my favorite sandwich: a cheese and tomato sandwich. First, you need the ingredients. You will need two pieces of bread, some butter, a few pieces of cheese, and one tomato. You also need a knife and a plate. The first step is to take the two pieces of bread and put them on the plate. Next, you use the knife to spread a little butter on one side of each piece of bread. This keeps the bread from getting wet. After that, you put the pieces of cheese on one of the pieces of bread. Then, you wash the tomato and cut it into thin pieces. You put the tomato pieces on top of the cheese. You can add a little salt and pepper if you like. Finally, you take the other piece of bread and put it on top. You can cut the sandwich in half if you want. It makes it easier to eat. And there you have it  a delicious and healthy sandwich. It is a perfect lunch for a busy day.

The story was interesting, and there were some surprising moments. The play had two parts. In the middle, there was a short break of fifteen minutes. We went to the bar and had a drink. The second part was even funnier than the first. At the end of the play, all the actors came on stage, and the audience clapped for a long time. It was a wonderful evening. I hope we can go to the theater again soon. It is a very special experience.

A big screen on the wall shows all the flight information. It tells you the flight number, the destination, and the gate number. You have to find your gate and wait there. You can watch the planes take off and land through the big windows. It is amazing to see such big machines fly into the air. An airport is like a small city that never sleeps.

I cut the onions and tomatoes and cooked them slowly. It took me a long time, and I made the kitchen very dirty. But the final result was surprisingly good! It was a delicious meal. This success gave me the confidence to try more recipes. I learned how to roast a chicken, make soup, and even bake a simple cake. Now, I cook my own dinner almost every evening. I really enjoy it. I love trying new things and the feeling of creating something delicious from different ingredients. Cooking is a very useful skill, and I am so happy I decided to learn.

It is a big, white cup with a picture of a cat on it. When the coffee is ready, I pour it into my cup. I add a little bit of milk, but no sugar. Then, I take my cup of coffee and sit in my favorite chair by the window. For ten minutes, I just sit, drink my coffee slowly, and look outside. This quiet time is very important. articles.title: A Helpful Stranger

I bought a lot of things: milk, bread, vegetables, and chicken. My bag was very heavy. As I was walking home, the rain started again. I was trying to walk fast, but then something terrible happened. The paper bag got wet and broke. All my food fell out onto the wet street. A bottle of milk broke. I felt so sad and tired, I wanted to cry. Just then, a woman with a big umbrella stopped her car. She was a stranger. I never saw her before. She said, 'Oh, you poor thing! Let me help you.' She helped me to pick up my food. She gave me a strong plastic bag from her car for my things. Then she said, 'Where do you live? I can give you a ride home. You can't walk in this rain.' I was so surprised by her kindness. She drove me right to my front door. I thanked her many times. This helpful stranger completely changed my bad day into a good one. It reminded me that there are many good people in the world.

articles.title: A Message in a Bottle

They were building a big sandcastle near the water. Suddenly, Sam saw something in the water. It was a small, green glass bottle. It was closed with a cork. 'Look, Tom!' he shouted. 'A bottle!' articles.title: A Story About a Lost Key
articles.articleText: Yesterday was a very long day. After a hard day at work, I walked home. I was very tired and just wanted to relax on my sofa. I walked up to my apartment on the third floor. I put my hand in my coat pocket to get my key. But the key was not there. I checked my other pocket. Nothing. I checked my bag. No key. I started to feel very worried. I looked everywhere, but I could not find it. I thought, 'Oh no, I lost my key!' I sat on the stairs outside my door and felt very sad. What could I do? Then, I had an idea. I remembered that my neighbor, Mrs. Smith, has a spare key to my apartment. I only gave it to her for emergencies. I went to her door and rang the bell. She opened the door with a friendly smile. I explained my problem. 'Don't worry, dear,' she said. She went and got my key. I was so happy and thankful. I unlocked my door and finally got inside my apartment. It was a terrible feeling to be locked out of my own home. I will be much more careful with my key in the future.

articles.title: A Conversation with my Grandfather
articles.articleText: My grandfather is eighty years old. He has lived a very long and interesting life. Last Sunday, I sat with him in the garden, and he told me some stories about his past. He told me about when he was a young boy. He lived in a very small town. They did not have television or computers back then. For fun, he and his friends played outside all day. They played football in the street and swam in the river in the summer. He said it was a simple but happy life. He also told me about his first job. He was sixteen years old, and he worked in a shop that sold bread. He had to wake up very early every morning. The work was hard, but he learned a lot about talking to people and working hard. He also told me a funny story about how he met my grandmother. They met at a dance. He was too shy to ask her to dance at first. I love listening to my grandfather's stories. They are like a window into a different world. It helps me to understand him better and to learn about history in a very personal way.

articles.title: A Student's Homework Routine
articles.articleText: I am a university student, and I have a lot of homework to do every week. To make sure I finish everything on time, I have a clear homework routine. I do my homework in the evening, after I have dinner. I usually start at around seven o'clock. First, I go to my desk in my bedroom. I make sure my desk is clean and I have everything I need: my books, my notebooks, a pen, and my computer. Before I start, I make a small list of the things I need to do. For example, 'Read Chapter 5 for History' or 'Write the first paragraph of the English report'. This helps me to stay focused. I try to work for about two hours every evening. I find it is better to work for a short time every day than to do everything on the weekend. Sometimes the work is difficult and boring. When I feel tired, I take a short break. I walk around my room for five minutes or get a glass of water. After I finish my homework, I relax. I watch a TV show or listen to music. Having a good routine helps me to be a successful student and still have some free time.

articles.title: The Supermarket on Saturday
articles.articleText: Going to the supermarket on a Saturday afternoon is an adventure. It is the busiest time of the week. The place is full of people. There are families with children, old people, and young people all pushing their shopping carts. The first thing I do is get a cart and my shopping list. The list is very important because it is easy to forget things when it is so busy. I usually start in the fruit and vegetable section. I choose some apples, bananas, and carrots. Then, I move to the back of the store to get milk, cheese, and eggs. The lines for the fresh meat and fish are always very long. You have to be patient and wait. I walk up and down every aisle to make sure I don't miss anything on my list. The loudest part of the store is the aisle with snacks and drinks, where many children are asking their parents for chocolate and sweets. The final step is the checkout. This is the hardest part. The lines are very long. I usually have to wait for ten or fifteen minutes. It is a long and sometimes tiring trip, but it is necessary to get food for the week.

articles.title: A Day as a Tourist Guide
articles.articleText: My cousin, Maria, has a very interesting job. She is a tourist guide in our city. Last Tuesday, she invited me to join one of her tours to see what her job is like. Her tour group was a small group of about fifteen people from different countries. They were all very friendly and excited to see the city. The tour was a walking tour of the old part of the city. It lasted for three hours. Maria's job is to walk with the group and tell them about the history of the buildings and streets. She has to know a lot of facts and dates. She also tells funny stories to make the tour interesting. She has a very clear and strong voice so that everyone can hear her. She also has to answer a lot of questions. People asked about the best restaurants, where to buy presents, and how to use the bus. Maria was very patient and helpful with all the questions. It is a hard job because she has to walk and talk for many hours. But she loves it because she meets new people every day and she loves sharing the story of our city.

articles.title: A Change of Plan
articles.articleText: Last weekend, my friends and I had a plan. We wanted to go to the beach on Saturday. We were all very excited. We planned to take a train in the morning, swim in the ocean, play volleyball, and have a picnic for lunch. I prepared some sandwiches, and my friend Ana said she would bring some fruit. However, when I woke up on Saturday morning, my plan changed. I looked out the window, and it was raining very hard. The sky was dark gray, and it was quite cold. I was very disappointed. I sent a message to my friends. 'I don't think we can go to the beach today,' I wrote. They were all sad too. But then my friend Leo had another idea. He said, 'Why don't we go to the indoor swimming pool instead? And after that, we can go to my house to watch a movie.' Everyone thought it was a great idea. So, we changed our plan. The indoor pool was warm and fun. We swam for two hours. After that, we went to Leo's house. We ate our sandwiches and fruit while we watched a funny movie. In the end, we had a fantastic day, even though it was very different from our original plan.

articles.title: My First Time Seeing Snow
articles.articleText: I grew up in a very warm country. We never had a real winter. I had only seen snow in movies and pictures. So, when I moved to a cold country for university, I was very excited about seeing snow for the first time. I waited for many weeks in November and December. The weather got colder and colder, but there was no snow. Then, one morning in January, I woke up and looked out my window. Everything was white! It was a beautiful and magical sight. I got dressed very quickly in my warmest clothes. I put on my big coat, my hat, and my gloves. I ran outside. The air was cold and fresh. I touched the snow. It was soft and very cold. I made a small snowball in my hand. I watched the other people. Children were laughing and playing. Some were building a big snowman. I walked around the park near my house. The trees looked so beautiful with snow on their branches. It was very quiet. The snow made everything peaceful. It was one of the most amazing moments of my life. I will never forget my first snow.

articles.title: Writing an Email to a Friend
articles.articleText: Writing an email is a quick and easy way to stay in touch with people who live far away. Let me show you how I write a simple email to a friend. First, I open my email program on my computer. I click on the 'New Email' button. A new window opens. There are a few boxes to fill in. In the 'To' box, I write my friend's email address. It is very important to write the address correctly, or the email will not arrive. In the 'Subject' box, I write a short title for my email, like 'Hello from London' or 'My news'. This tells my friend what the email is about. Then, I move to the main part, the body of the email. I always start with a friendly greeting, like 'Dear Anna,' or 'Hi Mark,'. After the greeting, I write my message. I usually ask my friend how they are. Then I share some of my own news. I write about my work, my hobbies, or a recent trip. I try to write in short, clear paragraphs. At the end of the email, I write a closing phrase, like 'Best wishes,' or 'Talk soon,'. Finally, I write my name. Before I click 'Send', I always read my email one more time to check for any mistakes.
